questions.question: What is the primary psychological shift required when moving from a solo practitioner to a visionary leader (Scaling Mindset)?
options: Focusing more on the technical execution of coaching sessions
Shifting from 'doing the work' to 'designing the systems' that do the work
Increasing the number of one-on-one hours billed per week
Decreasing the reliance on technology to maintain a personal touch
questions.explanation: Scaling requires a mindset shift from being the sole provider of value to being the architect of a system that delivers value through others or through technology.

questions.question: In the context of Group Coaching Dynamics, what is the 'Group Cohesion Effect'?
options: The tendency for group members to stop coaching after three sessions
The phenomenon where peer-to-peer support and collective wisdom accelerate individual transformation
A marketing tactic used to pressure clients into buying more products
The process of the coach dominating the conversation to ensure accuracy
questions.explanation: The Group Cohesion Effect leverages the power of community, allowing clients to learn from one another's experiences, which often leads to deeper and faster results than solo coaching.

questions.question: When building a coaching team, which three criteria (The 3 Cs) are essential for maintaining Kingdom alignment?
options: Cost, Capacity, and Communication
Character, Competence, and Chemistry
Credentials, Cognition, and Creativity
Compliance, Control, and Compensation
questions.explanation: Christian leadership frameworks emphasize Character (spiritual integrity), Competence (skill), and Chemistry (cultural and relational fit) when selecting team members.

questions.question: Which component is considered the 'backbone' of a scalable Digital Ecosystem in online ministry?
options: A high-end DSLR camera
A Learning Management System (LMS) that hosts asynchronous content
An automated direct messaging bot on social media
A daily email newsletter written manually every morning
questions.explanation: An LMS allows for asynchronous learning, meaning the coach can deliver value to thousands of people simultaneously without being physically present for every interaction.

questions.question: A 'Strategic Alliance' or B2B partnership in Christian coaching most likely involves which of the following?
options: Selling coaching services to individual clients through Facebook ads
Partnering with a local church or non-profit to provide coaching to their entire leadership team
Hiring a virtual assistant to manage your schedule
Trading coaching sessions for office supplies
questions.explanation: B2B (Business-to-Business) or B2O (Business-to-Organization) involves institutional contracts that allow for scaling impact across an entire group or workforce.

questions.question: According to financial stewardship principles for high-impact growth, what is a healthy percentage of gross revenue to reinvest into business development and scaling?
options: 100% for the first five years
questions.explanation: A benchmark for growth-oriented firms is reinvesting 20-30% of revenue into marketing, team, and infrastructure to ensure sustainable expansion.

questions.question: Why is Intellectual Property (IP), such as a proprietary coaching model, vital for scaling a coaching practice?
options: It makes it harder for clients to understand the process
It allows the coach to charge lower prices
It creates a replicable framework that other coaches on your team can use to produce consistent results
It is required by the government for all coaching businesses
questions.explanation: Proprietary models (IP) codify the coach's unique methodology, making it possible to train other coaches to deliver the same quality of results, which is essential for scaling.

questions.question: In 'Legacy Planning,' what is the primary goal of a 'Succession Plan'?
options: To ensure the business closes immediately upon the founder's retirement
To identify and prepare a successor to maintain the ministry’s impact and mission beyond the founder’s tenure
To maximize the sale price of the email list to the highest bidder
To prevent any other coaches from using the founder's name
questions.explanation: Succession planning ensures that the Kingdom impact of the coaching ministry continues by transitioning leadership to a prepared successor.

questions.question: What metric is most important when evaluating the efficiency of a digital marketing funnel for a coaching program?
options: Total number of Instagram followers
Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) relative to Lifetime Value (LTV)
The number of likes on a post
The color scheme of the landing page
questions.explanation: For sustainable scaling, the cost to acquire a customer (CAC) must be significantly lower than the total value that customer brings over time (LTV).

questions.question: Coach David wants to scale his ministry from 15 clients to 150. He is currently at full capacity. Based on the module, what is his best strategic move?
options: Work 14 hours a day to fit everyone in
Raise his prices until he only has 5 clients left
Launch a 'Signature Group Program' supported by a digital curriculum and a junior coach
Stop coaching and focus exclusively on writing a book
questions.explanation: Moving to a 'one-to-many' model (Group Program) combined with digital assets and team support allows David to serve 150 people without a linear increase in his personal workload.
